scoring_steps.explanation: Customer age of 57.4 places them in the 50-59 bracket. Mortality risk increases with age - this age bracket has a base risk factor of 0.40. Actuarial tables show mortality rates increase exponentially after age 50. In our historical data, customers aged 52-62 (n=1945) had an average risk score of 0.398 with a 0.21% claim rate.

Gender: Female. Actuarial data consistently shows males have 10-15% higher mortality rates across most age groups due to higher rates of heart disease, accidents, and risky behaviors. This results in a risk factor of 0.45. Historical female customers (n=4991) average a 0.341 risk score.

Occupation: Designer (Class I (Low Risk)). Occupational mortality varies significantly based on workplace hazards, stress levels, and accident risk. This occupation class carries a 0.20 risk factor. Class I (Low Risk) workers in our data (n=3971) show 0.13% claim rates.

BMI: 28.4 (Overweight). Body Mass Index is strongly correlated with mortality risk. Both underweight and overweight conditions increase mortality through different mechanisms (malnutrition vs. cardiovascular disease, diabetes). This BMI level carries a 0.40 risk factor. Customers with similar BMI (n=2324) have 100.0% chronic condition rates.

Blood Pressure: 125/70 mmHg (Elevated). Hypertension is a leading risk factor for heart disease, stroke, and kidney disease. The American Heart Association defines stages based on systolic readings. This reading indicates elevated blood pressure with a 0.30 risk factor. Customers with similar BP (n=5813) average 0.347 risk scores.

Total Cholesterol: 204 mg/dL (HDL: 52, LDL: 132) - Borderline High. High cholesterol is a major risk factor for atherosclerosis and coronary artery disease. LDL ('bad' cholesterol) should be <100 mg/dL ideally, HDL ('good' cholesterol) should be >40 mg/dL. This profile indicates borderline high risk with a 0.50 factor. Similar cholesterol profiles (n=4653) average 0.369 risk.

Smoking Status: Former (<5 years). Smoking is THE single largest modifiable risk factor for mortality. Current smokers have 2-3x higher mortality rates than non-smokers due to cancer, heart disease, and respiratory illness. This status carries a 0.50 risk factor (15% of total score). Former (<5 years) customers (n=1133) average $4,400 annual premiums.

Alcohol Consumption: Heavy (>7/week). Heavy alcohol use increases mortality through liver disease, accidents, and cardiovascular issues. Moderate consumption shows J-curved mortality (slight benefit vs. none, but heavy use is harmful). This consumption level has a 0.80 risk factor. Customers with heavy (>7/week) consumption (n=506) average 0.369 risk.

Exercise Frequency: Active (5+/week). Regular physical activity is strongly protective against all-cause mortality, reducing risk by 20-30%. Exercise improves cardiovascular health, maintains healthy weight, and reduces chronic disease risk. This activity level has a 0.15 risk factor. Active (5+/week) customers (n=1553) have average BMI of 24.3.

Chronic Conditions: Arthritis. Presence of 1 chronic condition(s) significantly increases mortality risk. Each condition adds compounding risk through disease progression and comorbidity effects. Risk factor: 0.60. Customers with similar condition profiles (n=1643) have 0.18% claim rates.
Family History: None. No significant family history reported. Risk factor: 0.20.

Dangerous Hobbies: Skydiving. Participation in skydiving significantly increases accident and fatality risk. These activities carry substantially higher mortality rates than general population. Risk factor: 0.90. Customers with dangerous hobbies (n=10000) average 0.344 risk.

summary:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY - Customer NEW-0001
======================================================================

RISK ASSESSMENT: Average Risk - Standard
Final Risk Score: 0.4705 (0 = lowest risk, 1 = highest risk)

PRICING RECOMMENDATION:
  • Recommended Annual Premium: $9,063.38
  • Price Range: $7,067.77 - $10,393.78
  • Coverage Amount: $1,450,000

CUSTOMER PROFILE:
  • Age: 57 | Gender: Female | Occupation: Designer
  • BMI: 28.4 | BP: 125/70
  • Smoking: Former (<5 years)

TOP RISK FACTORS:
  1. Age: 57.4 years (+0.0800 to risk score)
  2. Smoking Status: Former (<5 years) (+0.0750 to risk score)
  3. Body Mass Index (BMI): 28.4 (Overweight) (+0.0600 to risk score)

PROTECTIVE FACTORS:
  1. Exercise Frequency: Active (5+/week) (Low risk contribution: 0.0060)
  2. Family History: None (Low risk contribution: 0.0100)

UNDERWRITER NOTES:
Based on the comprehensive risk assessment across 12 factors, this customer presents a 
average risk - standard profile. The pricing recommendation of $9,063.38 annually 
provides adequate margin while remaining competitive in the market.
